result.execSummary:
The defendant Tydis Trinard Odom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
******7-8-14 Judge Dugan, Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to state zero days of sentence credit on count two *******
Concurrent with: **Concurrent with count one, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit of 87 days.
*4/20/2015  to reflect: count one is concurrent with count two.  Count two is concurrent with count one, but consecutive to any other sentence. Credit of 87 days should be applied to both count one and count two.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge as to all four counts.  Pay all remaining costs and surcharges.  If not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain full time employment.  Obtain GED/HSED.  Participate in vocational programming.

No illegal drugs.
No contact with Anotinette F. or her family.
Participate in:   cognitive behavioral therapy programming, Batterers Intervention programming and sex offender treatment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with programming.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court denied defense request for expungement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Roggensack, C.J., did not particiate, and Ann Walsh Bradley. J., withdrew from participations.

per order dated February 22, 2018, Appeal No. 2015AP2525-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the voluntary dismissal is granted, and the appeal is dismissed, without costs.

The response brief of plaintiff-respondent, State of Wisconsin, shall be served and filed on or before January 19, 2018. records.addlTxt: per order dated September 27, 2017, Appeal No. 2015AP2525-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted.  The Brief of defendant-appellant, Tydis Trinard Odom, shall be served and filed on or before November 13, 2017.

per order dated September 12, 2017, Appeal No. 2015AP2525CR, IT IS ORDERED the certification is grated and the appeal is accepted for consideration of all issues raised before the court of appeals. When this court grants direct review upon certification, it acquires jurisdiction of the case, Wis. Const. art. VII, 3(3), that is, the entire appeal, which includes all issues, not merely the issues certified or the issue for which the court accepts certification. Further, the court has jurisdiction over issues not certified because the court may review an issues directly on its own motion. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within 30 days after the date of this order the appellant must file either a brief in this court of a statement that no brief will be filed; that within 20 days of filing, the respondent must file either a brief or a statement that no brief will be filed; and that is a brief is filed by the respondent, within 10 days of filing, the appellant must file either a reply brief or a statement that no reply brief will be filed; and
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that in any brief filed in this court the parties shall not incorporate by reference any portion of their court of appeals' brief; instead, any material upon which there is reliance should be restated in the brief in this court; and 
IT IS FUTHER ORDERED that in the event any part elects not to file a brief in this court, the briefs previously submitted by that party to the court of appeals shall stand as the party's brief in the Supreme Court; and 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within the time period established for the filing briefs, each party must provide the clerk of this court with copies of the briefs previously filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals. If a party elects to file a new brief(s), 10 copies of their court of appeals brief(s) must be provided. If a party elects to stand on their court of appeals brief(s), 17 copies of each of their court of appeals brief(s) must be provided.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the parties shall be notified of the date and time for oral arguments in this appeal in due course.
Roggensack,C.J., did not participate.

records.addlTxt: Counts three and four.
Counts one and two.

AS TO AMENDED COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as AMENDED and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 3 AND COUNT 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as AMENDED and as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms or body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
